title: Rory Stewart faces backlash after describing three black men from filmed walkabout as 'minor gangsters'
text:
Rory Stewart has been accused of racism after describing three young black men he met on a filmed walkabout as “minor gangsters”.

The former Tory MP had a run-in with the group - two of whom were members of the Irish hip hop group Hare Squead - as he vied for the Conservative leadership over the summer.

In an awkward exchange, the politician greeted the trio but was given short shrift after revealing he was campaigning to become Prime Minister.

Mr Stewart is now facing a backlash after making a bizarre link between the men he met in east London and gang culture, leading one of them to suggest the comments had racist undertones.

Speaking about the incident, which was posted on social media with the caption “can’t win ‘em all”, at an event in London this week, Mr Stewart said: “One thing about social media is that it allows people to see politicians listening.

“I can go to Brick Lane and three sort of minor gangsters can come up to me and spend a minute telling me I’m an idiot.

“And I can film it on my phone and put it up. And people love watching people being rude to politicians.”
description: Rory Stewart has been accused of racism after describing three young black men he met on a filmed walkabout as “minor gangsters”.
